newsitem.title: UK: UK MPs to probe air traffic control plans.
newsitem.headline: UK MPs to probe air traffic control plans.

text.p: The British parliament's Transport Committee said on Wednesday it was to hold an inquiry into Britain's air traffic control service in which it would seek to discover whether the government had revived privatisation plans.
The Committee said in a statement it would take evidence over the next four weeks from National Air Traffic Services Ltd (NATS), the Civil Aviation Authority, airlines and the Transport Department.
A report in Wednesday's Guardian newspaper suggested the government could consider a hasty privatisation to raise some 600 million stg for tax cuts ahead of the forthcoming general election.
However, a spokesman for the Transport Department said: "It is the government's objective to privatise, but there is no decision on timing."

The Committee statement said the inquiry would also seek to discover whether NATS still planned to operate two en-route air traffic control centres in future, and whether it still planned a new centre at Prestwick in Scotland. -- London Newsroom +44 171 5427767
